thread.title: Dinner, basket raffle to benefit chief's family after father killed in Christmas Eve fire
thread.title_full: Dinner, basket raffle to benefit chief's family after father killed in Christmas Eve fire

author: Bill Shannon
title: Dinner, basket raffle to benefit chief's family after father killed in Christmas Eve fire
text:
WTAJ Altoona Dinner, basket raffle to benefit chief’s family after father killed in Christmas Eve fire Bill Shannon Thu, December 26, 2024 at 8:17 PM UTC 1 min read
CLEARFIELD COUNTY, Pa. (WTAJ) — In continued support for the Winburne Fire Chief’s family, a spaghetti dinner and basket raffle will be held in Morrisdale.
The dinner and raffle are set to take place Sunday, Jan. 12 at the Morris Township Volunteer Fire Company Recreation Center (1104 Deer Creek Road, Morrisdale) from 1-4 p.m.
The meal comes with spaghetti and meatballs, salad, bread, a beverage and dessert. It’s $10 for adults and $5 for kids 12 and under and you can dine in or grab it to go. For more information or to donate for the basket raffle, click here .
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Volunteer Fire Chief’s father dies in Clearfield County fire, community mourns
All proceeds will go to benefit the Dunlap family after the family patriarch, Clifford, also known as Butch, died suddenly on Christmas Eve when his home caught fire and he was unable to get out. Butch is the father of Winburne’s Fire Chief, Robert.
Morris Township Volunteer Fire Company said in a post on their social media that Butch was a “life member” of the Winburne Fire Company. They said he dedicated many years of service to the community and was considered a “pillar.” People knew Butch for his kindness and willingness to help anyone, they added.
